conditions.name: CRU Admission Rescheduling
conditions.description: Condition for rescheduling admission to the CRU on Day 1.
conditions.text: Admission can be rescheduled if Plasma Glucose (PG) level is not 90 to 250 mg/dL on Day 1.

conditions.name: Stop Insulin Infusion
conditions.description: Condition to stop the insulin infusion used to induce hypoglycemia.
conditions.text: Insulin infusion is stopped once bedside Plasma Glucose (PG) is <60 mg/dL.

conditions.name: Interim Safety Review
conditions.description: A safety review is required after a subset of patients complete Period 2 before dosing the remaining patients.
conditions.text: Safety data will be reviewed after the first 6 patients are administered LY900018 in Period 2. The remaining patients will be dosed after confirmation of the safety.

conditions.name: Study Stopping Rule
conditions.description: The entire study may be stopped based on the interim safety review.
conditions.text: Following the review of the safety data from the first 6 patients to complete Period 2 Day 1, the study will be stopped if deemed necessary for patient safety in the opinion of the Investigator and sponsor.

conditions.name: Additional Follow-up for TE ADA
conditions.description: Condition triggering an extended follow-up period for immunogenicity testing.
conditions.text: Patients with treatment-emergent antidrug antibodies (TE ADA) at follow-up/ED will undergo additional follow-up.

conditions.name: Patient Replacement Criteria
conditions.description: Criteria for replacing a discontinued patient.
conditions.text: If patients discontinue from the study before completion of both periods with evaluable primary outcome for any reason, the patient may be replaced. Replacement should not occur beyond 75 patients enrolled.

conditions.name: Inadvertent Enrollment
conditions.description: Condition where a patient is found to not meet enrollment criteria after being enrolled.
conditions.text: The sponsor or investigator identifies a patient who did not meet enrollment criteria and was inadvertently enrolled.

transitionRules.name: Screening to Treatment Period 1
transitionRules.text: Patients who complete screening and meet all eligibility criteria will be randomized and proceed to Treatment Period 1.

transitionRules.name: Period 1 to Period 2
transitionRules.text: After completing Period 1, patients enter a washout period of 3 to 14 days before starting Period 2.

transitionRules.name: Discontinuation of Inadvertently Enrolled Patients
transitionRules.text: If an inadvertently enrolled patient is identified, a discussion must occur between the Lilly CP/CRP and the investigator to determine if the patient may continue. If both agree it is medically appropriate, documented approval must be obtained to allow the patient to continue.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Patient Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The patient, or legal representative, requests to be withdrawn from the study.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Investigator Decision
scheduleTimelineExits.description: The investigator decides that the patient should be discontinued from the study for any reason. If due to an AE/SAE, appropriate measures are to be taken.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Other Study Enrollment
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Enrollment in any other clinical study involving an investigational product or other incompatible medical research.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Medical, Safety, or Regulatory Reasons
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Participation in the study needs to be stopped for medical, safety, regulatory, or other reasons consistent with applicable laws, regulations, and good clinical practice.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Lost to Follow-up
scheduleTimelineExits.description: A patient is considered lost to follow-up if they repeatedly fail to return for scheduled visits and cannot be contacted by the study site.

scheduleTimelineExits.name: Study Completion
scheduleTimelineExits.description: Patient completes both treatment periods and the final follow-up visit.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Interim Safety Review Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to continue dosing remaining patients or stop the entire study based on a safety review of the first 6 patients to complete Period 2.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Inadvertent Enrollment Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision point to determine if an inadvertently enrolled patient should continue in the study or be discontinued.

scheduledDecisionInstances.name: Additional Follow-up Decision
scheduledDecisionInstances.description: Decision to initiate an extended immunogenicity follow-up schedule for patients who are positive for treatment-emergent antidrug antibodies.
